sampleData.Title: Ranch 3592 2024 Almonds
sampleData.Scope:
*Previously OPPLAWS-003130* _x000D_
N/S Planting 22' x 18' Spacing _x000D_
Single line hose, 1 fan-jet per tree, 40A 12 GPH (subject to change) _x000D_
Variety will change per row, dual manifold, dual submain. Isolation valves for each variety. 2 Set system, same acreage per set. Option for flush manifolds. _x000D_
Typical Wonderful Orchards filter upgrades on 3 stations. Replace all mild steel with stainless, replace all appurtenances, Netafim airvents, include grooved connections before and after flow meter for easy service. _x000D_
 _x000D_
Reservoir clean up and lining not part of this scope. _x000D_
 _x000D_
See ARC GIS for field layout and Box for filter pictures and old planset.

sampleData.Title: Wormwood 23 Electric Pumps Winter 2025
sampleData.Scope: Customer wants two separate electric pumps built on separate reservoir / Canals on Wormwood 23. Customer will provide the reservoir and the concrete pads for the pumps. Customer wants to be able to sprinkle 80-100 acres at a time or about 8000GPM with both pumps running. He wants it to be split into two different phases. The first phase will be just the pumps with a cross coming off of it to hook up the mainline. the second phase will have underground pvc running to each individual block with a connection to a 10 in mainline. See ArcGIS.

summary:
LAUREL AG & WATER MASTER DATA ANALYSIS

FILE OVERVIEW:
The Excel file contains 4 sheets with comprehensive business data for Laurel Ag & Water, 
an irrigation systems company operating primarily in California (Bakersfield, Hanford, 
Delano, Lodi, Corning, Colusa) and Arizona (Yuma, Brawley).

KEY FINDINGS:

1. REVENUE PIPELINE:
   - Total Projected Revenue: $41,538,501.00
   - Probability-Weighted Revenue: $3,250,700.00
   - Total Margin Amount: $6,529,020.01
   - Average Margin: 19.6%
   - Number of Opportunities: 45 projects
   - Date Range: 2023-06-02 to 2024-10-07

2. PROJECT STATUS BREAKDOWN:
   - Design Stage (39 projects): $37,803,501.00
   - Design Review/Sales (6 projects): $3,735,000.00

3. TOP SALES REPRESENTATIVES:
   - Steven Roland: $33,315,000.00 (14 projects)
   - Zachary Scott: $2,330,000.00 (5 projects)
   - Joseph Turner: $2,070,000.00 (3 projects)

4. TOP LOCATIONS BY REVENUE:
   - Bakersfield: $34,855,000.00 (18 projects)
   - Hanford: $2,150,000.00 (4 projects)
   - Yuma: $1,120,000.00 + $1,100,000.00

5. LARGEST PROJECTS:
   - Kern Kraft Reservoir and Filter (Grimmway Farms): $30,000,000
   - Picacho Ranch Guayule Phase 2 (Bridgestone): $1,100,000
   - Ranch 3592 Almonds: $1,000,000
   - Wormwood 23 Electric Pumps: $900,000
   - Pinkham 2 Kiwis: $880,000

6. BUSINESS MODEL:
   - Primary business: Turnkey irrigation projects (design, installation, equipment)
   - Customer base: Large agricultural operations (orchards, farms, nurseries)
   - Products: Drip irrigation, sprinkler systems, pumps, filters, reservoirs
   - Crops served: Almonds, pistachios, olives, kiwis, guayule, citrus, and more

7. SUPPORTING DATA:
   - Items catalog: 26,718 products from various vendors
   - Vendor network: 2,849 suppliers
   - Customer base: 4,900 clients

INSIGHTS:
- The pipeline is heavily concentrated in one mega-project (Kern Kraft at $30M, 72% of total)
- Most projects are in design phase, indicating future revenue (not yet invoiced)
- Strong presence in California's Central Valley agricultural region
- High-margin business (avg 19.6%) selling turnkey irrigation solutions
- Weighted revenue ($3.25M) significantly lower than projected ($41.5M) due to low win probabilities
